page.title: 06Farming Continued.
page.content: {WAUNYCAERAU.} This is an all grass farm of about 90 acres.It is situated in the west of our region.The interesting feature about this farm is its pedigree herd of Herefordshire cattle.There are 35 cows and 2 bulls.They are bred for beef only.This type of herd is not as profitable or as popular as it used to be although they are cheap to rear. As each calf is born it has to be registered and its pedigree can be traced back 50 years. They eat grass and hay with some bran, rolled oats,beetpulp,flakemaize and minerals.They grow 5 fields of hay which makes 3,000 bales.No corn is grown.They keep 150 sheep.They have their own pure water supply which is pumped up through a 60ft.bore hole.The farm supports 4 people.There is 1 part time helper.
